heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 14 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 2.4°C) and feels like temperature (up 2.1°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 5%) and rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 2670 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9921 lux), cloud levels (up 847 m), feels like temperature (up 4.1°C), and outside temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 346.8m higher than yesterday, 266.5m lower than the past week, 846.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 557m minimum and 1248m maximum, with an average of 1292.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1559.0m and 2140m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Showers, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
